greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = prime(n) + prime(n+1) - prime(n+2).
comment: Sequence is non-monotonic: see, e.g., a(29), a(33), and a(41). - _Zak Seidov_, Jan 21 2013
Ishikawa proved that a(n) > 0 for n > 1. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Feb 13 2014
link: Michel Marcus, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000 (terms 1..1000 from Zak Seidov)
Heihachiro Ishikawa, Über die Verteilung der Primzahlen, Sci. Rep. Tokyo Bunrika Daigaku, Sect. A 2 (1934), 27-40.
program: (PARI) first(n)=my(v=vector(n),p=2,q=3,k); forprime(r=5,, if(k++>n, break); v[k]=p+q-r; p=q; q=r); v \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 03 2017
results.author: _Cino Hilliard_, Aug 04 2004
ext: Definition reworded by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 27 2012
